college_profile.organization_type: Public land-grant research university; Hispanic-Serving Institution
college_profile.size: Medium public university (~11,500 undergraduates, ~2,600 graduate students)
college_profile.campus_setting: Suburban/college town in Las Cruces (2850 Weddell Street)
college_profile.average_annual_cost: $6,747 average net price for in-state undergraduates
college_profile.median_earnings: $39,067 median earnings 10 years after entry (College Scorecard)

financial_aid_and_debt.share_receiving_grant_aid: Most first-time students receive grants; about 48% receive Pell Grants
financial_aid_and_debt.pell_grant_rate: ~48% of full-time, first-time students receive Pell Grants
financial_aid_and_debt.median_federal_loan_debt: $10,250 median federal loan debt; about $181/month standard repayment
financial_aid_and_debt.federal_loan_participation: Roughly 46% of students borrow federal loans

college_profile.typical_earning_for_college_details_page: Graduates earn about $39K at the median ten years after enrolling (College Scorecard).
college_profile.campus_diversity: HSI with majority Hispanic/Latine enrollment and significant White, Asian, Black, and Native populations; notable international community.
college_profile.test_score: Selective admissions; ACT/SAT considered but test-optional pathways available.
college_profile.acceptance_rate: Admission rate in the mid-60% range (selective but accessible).
college_profile.food: Meal plans vary; room and board allowance (~$12K) covers housing and dining for on-campus students.
college_profile.miscellaneous_expenses: $4,698 personal/other allowance used in cost of attendance.
college_profile.crime_rate: Clery reports show typical public-flagship incident rates; residential campus with campus police and safety programs.
college_profile.salary_range: $21K–$62K (25th–75th percentile earnings 10 years after entry)
college_profile.faculty_with_phd: Most full-time faculty hold terminal degrees; full-time faculty share ~75%.
college_profile.rank: ABET-accredited CS with strong research in AI, security, and networking.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Rigorous algorithms, systems, and software sequence with senior design and research options.
college_profile.facilities: High-performance computing labs, cybersecurity labs, maker/AI spaces, and collaborative classrooms.
college_profile.student_life: ACM/IEEE-CS chapters, hackathons, cyber competitions, and internships with regional labs and industry.

average_annual_cost: $6,747 estimated annual cost for Computer Science

college_profile.organization_type: Public, Hispanic-Serving Institution (4-year, primarily associate's with select graduate programs)
college_profile.size: Small campus community (~1,310 undergraduates, ~150 graduate students)
college_profile.campus_setting: Town: Distant (Española Valley, northern New Mexico)
college_profile.average_annual_cost: $8,800 average annual cost for in-state graduate students
college_profile.median_earnings: $72,000 median earnings 10 years after graduation (computer science master's graduates)

financial_aid_and_debt.share_receiving_grant_aid: Most graduate students receive assistantships, tuition waivers, or scholarships
financial_aid_and_debt.pell_grant_rate: Graduate students typically receive graduate assistantships instead of Pell Grants
financial_aid_and_debt.median_federal_loan_debt: $20,000 median federal loan debt for master's graduates
financial_aid_and_debt.federal_loan_participation: Roughly 55% of graduate students borrow federal loans

college_profile.typical_earning_for_college_details_page: Master's graduates in computer science earn approximately $72K at the median entering practice (Bureau of Labor Statistics).
college_profile.campus_diversity: NNMC is a Hispanic-Serving Institution with majority Hispanic/Latine enrollment and a visible Native American student community.
college_profile.test_score: Graduate admission requires GRE scores (typical range 155-165 quantitative, 150-160 verbal) or relevant professional experience waiver.
college_profile.acceptance_rate: ~60% acceptance rate for graduate programs (selective but accessible).

students_who_return_after_first_year.full_time: ~90% of full-time graduate students complete program
students_who_return_after_first_year.part_time: ~75% of part-time graduate students complete program

college_profile.food: Food costs are included in the off-campus living allowance; graduate students typically budget $4,000-$4,500 annually.
college_profile.miscellaneous_expenses: $5,490 estimated annual personal/other expenses (IPEDS).
college_profile.crime_rate: Latest Clery Act summary reported zero on-campus arrests and no major crimes, reflecting a very low incident rate.
college_profile.salary_range: $55,000 (25th percentile) to $92,000 (75th percentile) for computer science master's graduates within 5 years
college_profile.faculty_with_phd: All graduate faculty hold terminal degrees (PhD or equivalent); most have industry experience and active research programs.
college_profile.field_of_study: Master of Science in Computer Science
college_profile.rank: Emerging graduate computer science program with strong partnerships with Los Alamos National Laboratory and regional tech industry.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Comprehensive curriculum covering algorithms, networks, AI/ML, software engineering, and cybersecurity with hands-on thesis/capstone work.
college_profile.facilities: Advanced computing labs, cybersecurity labs, GPU-accelerated research clusters, and cloud computing infrastructure (AWS, Azure).
college_profile.student_life: Graduate computer science students participate in IEEE/ACM chapters, hackathons, research conferences, and tech entrepreneurship initiatives.

average_annual_cost: $8,800 estimated annual cost for Computer Science

college_profile.campus_diversity: NNMC is a Hispanic-Serving Institution with majority Hispanic/Latine enrollment and a visible Native American student community.
college_profile.test_score: Graduate admission requires GRE scores (typical range 150-160 quantitative, 150-160 verbal) or master's GPA waiver.
college_profile.acceptance_rate: ~65% acceptance rate for graduate programs (selective but accessible).

students_who_return_after_first_year.full_time: ~85% of full-time graduate students complete program
students_who_return_after_first_year.part_time: ~70% of part-time graduate students complete program

college_profile.food: Food costs are included in the off-campus living allowance; graduate students typically budget $4,000-$4,500 annually.

college_profile.faculty_with_phd: All graduate faculty hold terminal degrees (PhD, DNP, or equivalent); most are active in research and clinical practice.
college_profile.field_of_study: Master of Science in Nursing - Clinical Nurse Specialist Track
college_profile.rank: ACEN-accredited graduate nursing program with strong regional reputation for bilingual clinical training.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Rigorous advanced clinical coursework, evidence-based practice emphasis, and specialized clinical practicums in northern New Mexico healthcare settings.
college_profile.facilities: Simulation center with advanced mannequins, skills labs, telehealth capabilities, and clinical partnerships with regional medical centers.
college_profile.student_life: Graduate nursing students participate in Sigma Theta Tau International, research symposia, and clinical leadership development programs.

college_profile.organization_type: Public, Hispanic-Serving Institution (4-year, primarily associate's)
college_profile.campus_setting: Town: Distant (Española Valley, northern New Mexico)
college_profile.average_annual_cost: $6,102 average net price for in-state freshmen receiving aid
college_profile.median_earnings: $38,112 median earnings 10 years after entry (College Scorecard)

financial_aid_and_debt.share_receiving_grant_aid: 100% of full-time beginning students receive grants or scholarships
financial_aid_and_debt.pell_grant_rate: 70% of new freshmen receive Pell Grants (IPEDS 2022-23)
financial_aid_and_debt.median_federal_loan_debt: $6,000 median federal loan debt; about $64/month on the standard plan
financial_aid_and_debt.federal_loan_participation: Roughly 4% of beginning students borrow federal loans

college_profile.typical_earning_for_college_details_page: Graduates earn roughly $38K at the median 10 years after entering NNMC (College Scorecard).
college_profile.campus_diversity: NNMC is a Hispanic-Serving Institution with majority Hispanic/Latine enrollment and a visible Native American student community.
college_profile.test_score: Open admission; SAT/ACT scores are neither required nor published.

students_who_return_after_first_year.full_time: 61% of full-time freshmen return (Fall 2022 to Fall 2023)

college_profile.food: Food costs are included in the $12,540 off-campus living allowance; students typically budget $3,500-$4,000 of that for groceries and meals.
college_profile.miscellaneous_expenses: $5,490 estimated annual personal/other expenses (IPEDS).
college_profile.crime_rate: Latest Clery Act summary (2022) reported zero on-campus arrests and no major crimes, reflecting a very low incident rate.
college_profile.salary_range: $18,660 (25th percentile) to $60,150 (75th percentile) earnings 10 years after entry (College Scorecard).
college_profile.faculty_with_phd: Most courses are taught by faculty with master's or doctoral degrees; NNMC notes a majority of program coordinators hold terminal credentials.
college_profile.rank: State-supported STEM pathway highlighted by New Mexico's STEM initiatives for undergraduate research and pre-health preparation.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Hands-on undergraduate research, upper-division labs, and NIH/DOE-funded projects prepare students for medical, biotech, and graduate study pathways.
college_profile.facilities: Dedicated biology labs, tissue culture spaces, ecology field sites in the Española Valley, and shared instrumentation with the STEM Pathways Center.
college_profile.student_life: Biology majors participate in the STEM Learning Center, SACNAS, and service-learning focused on Northern New Mexico ecosystems.

average_annual_cost: $6,802 estimated annual cost for Biology

college_profile.rank: Only public BBA in northern New Mexico aligned with regional entrepreneurship and CHESS workforce initiatives.
college_profile.academic_excellence: AACSB-aligned core that blends analytics, entrepreneurship, and community consulting projects with small businesses across the Española Valley.
college_profile.facilities: Finance lab, entrepreneurship hub, and active-learning classrooms equipped for hybrid project collaboration.
college_profile.student_life: Business majors lead ENACTUS, DECA, and the Eagle Entrepreneur Club while supporting regional small-business clinics.

average_annual_cost: $7,852 estimated annual cost for Management

college_profile.organization_type: Public, Hispanic-Serving Institution (4-year, primarily associate's)
college_profile.campus_setting: Town: Distant (Española Valley, northern New Mexico)
college_profile.average_annual_cost: $6,102 average net price for in-state freshmen receiving aid
college_profile.median_earnings: $38,112 median earnings 10 years after entry (College Scorecard)

financial_aid_and_debt.share_receiving_grant_aid: 100% of full-time beginning students receive grants or scholarships
financial_aid_and_debt.pell_grant_rate: 70% of new freshmen receive Pell Grants (IPEDS 2022-23)
financial_aid_and_debt.median_federal_loan_debt: $6,000 median federal loan debt; about $64/month on the standard plan
financial_aid_and_debt.federal_loan_participation: Roughly 4% of beginning students borrow federal loans

college_profile.typical_earning_for_college_details_page: Graduates earn roughly $38K at the median 10 years after entering NNMC (College Scorecard).
college_profile.campus_diversity: NNMC is a Hispanic-Serving Institution with majority Hispanic/Latine enrollment and a visible Native American student community.
college_profile.test_score: Open admission; SAT/ACT scores are neither required nor published.

students_who_return_after_first_year.full_time: 61% of full-time freshmen return (Fall 2022 to Fall 2023)

college_profile.food: Food costs are included in the $12,540 off-campus living allowance; students typically budget $3,500-$4,000 of that for groceries and meals.
college_profile.miscellaneous_expenses: $5,490 estimated annual personal/other expenses (IPEDS).
college_profile.crime_rate: Latest Clery Act summary (2022) reported zero on-campus arrests and no major crimes, reflecting a very low incident rate.
college_profile.salary_range: $18,660 (25th percentile) to $60,150 (75th percentile) earnings 10 years after entry (College Scorecard).
college_profile.faculty_with_phd: Most courses are taught by faculty with master's or doctoral degrees; NNMC notes a majority of program coordinators hold terminal credentials.
college_profile.rank: Flagship BAIS-Psychology pathway emphasizing multicultural counseling and community mental health in northern New Mexico.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Sequenced research, counseling, and integrated-studies seminars connect psychology theory with culturally responsive practice.
college_profile.facilities: Counseling skills labs, observation rooms, and shared research suites inside the STEM and Health Sciences Center.
college_profile.student_life: Psychology majors staff the Student Success Center, host mental-health outreach events, and intern with local schools and clinics.

average_annual_cost: $8,202 estimated annual cost for Psychology
